item.name: Authentication
item.description:
Authentication endpoints for user management

Required Headers:
- Content-Type: application/json

Environment Variables:
- {{token}}: JWT token received after login (automatically set)

Flow:
1. Register a new user
2. Login with credentials
3. Use the received token for authenticated requests
4. Logout to invalidate the token

request.description:
Register a new user

Request Body:
- username: string (min 3 chars)
- email: valid email address
- password: string (min 6 chars)

Response:
- 201: User created successfully
- 400: Invalid input or user exists

Login with email and password

Request Body:
- email: registered email address
- password: user's password

Response:
- 200: Login successful (includes JWT token)
- 401: Invalid credentials

Logout and invalidate the current token

Required Headers:
- Authorization: Bearer token

Response:
- 200: Logout successful
- 401: Not authenticated

item.name: Monsters
item.description:
Monster management endpoints

Required Headers:
- Content-Type: application/json

Features:
- Create, read, update, and delete monsters
- Basic monster attributes management

request.description:
Get all monsters

Response:
- 200: List of monsters
- 500: Server error

Create a new monster

Request Body:
- name: Monster name (string)
- level: Monster level (number, min: 1)
- hp: Hit points (number, min: 1)
- attack: Attack power (number, min: 0)
- defense: Defense power (number, min: 0)
- description: Monster description (string)

Response:
- 201: Monster created
- 400: Invalid input

Get a specific monster by ID

URL Parameters:
- id: Monster ID

Response:
- 200: Monster details
- 404: Monster not found
- 500: Server error

Update a monster's attributes

URL Parameters:
- id: Monster ID

Request Body:
- name: Monster name (string, optional)
- level: Monster level (number, min: 1, optional)
- hp: Hit points (number, min: 1, optional)
- attack: Attack power (number, min: 0, optional)
- defense: Defense power (number, min: 0, optional)
- description: Monster description (string, optional)

Response:
- 200: Monster updated
- 404: Monster not found
- 400: Invalid input

Delete a monster

URL Parameters:
- id: Monster ID

Response:
- 200: Monster deleted successfully
- 404: Monster not found
- 500: Server error

item.name: Battles
item.description:
Battle system endpoints

Required Headers:
- Content-Type: application/json

Features:
- Create and manage battles between characters
- Turn-based combat system
- Battle state tracking and logging

request.description:
Create a new battle between two characters

Request Body:
- player1: Character object (id, name, health, maxHealth, attack, defense, speed)
- player2: Character object (id, name, health, maxHealth, attack, defense, speed)

Response:
- 201: Battle created successfully
- 400: Invalid input

Start a battle

URL Parameters:
- battleId: ID of the battle to start

Response:
- 200: Battle started successfully
- 400: Invalid battle ID or battle already started
- 404: Battle not found

Execute a turn in the battle

URL Parameters:
- battleId: ID of the battle

Request Body:
- attackerId: ID of the attacking character
- defenderId: ID of the defending character

Response:
- 200: Turn executed successfully
- 400: Invalid battle state or character IDs
- 404: Battle not found

Get the current status of a battle

URL Parameters:
- battleId: ID of the battle

Response:
- 200: Current battle state
- 404: Battle not found

Get the battle log with all actions

URL Parameters:
- battleId: ID of the battle

Response:
- 200: Battle log with all actions
- 404: Battle not found
